summary: This is a cover email from the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP transmitting a sealed letter from the defense in the case U.S. v. Maxwell to Judge Nathan regarding proposed limiting instructions following the Court's November 19, 2021 Opinion and Order.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The defense is submitting a letter regarding proposed limiting instructions.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case U.S. v. Maxwell. The defense's letter regarding limiting instructions is addressed to her.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Court Issues Opinion and Order
events.description: The Court issued an Opinion and Order, which prompted the defense to submit a letter regarding proposed limiting instructions.

events.title: Defense Submits Sealed Letter on Limiting Instructions
events.description: The defense, via Cohen & Gresser LLP, submitted a letter to Judge Nathan regarding proposed limiting instructions in response to the Court's November 19 Opinion and Order. The letter was submitted temporarily under seal.

keyFacts: The document is a cover email transmitting a sealed defense letter in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330).
The defense letter addresses proposed limiting instructions following a Court Opinion and Order dated November 19, 2021.
The letter was submitted temporarily under seal, indicating sensitive legal arguments or information.
The law firm representing the defendant is Cohen & Gresser LLP, with offices in New York, Paris, Washington DC, and London.
The correspondence is directed to Judge Nathan, who is presiding over the case.
